title: Rebuild Advocate Website as React + TypeScript SPA

requirements.summary: Rebuild the entire advocate website as a React + TypeScript single-page application with React Router for client-side routing, replacing static HTML files with functional React components for Home, About, Cases, Appointment, and Contact pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The Vite/React app compiles without errors
Navigating to '/' renders the Home page with visible content
Navigating to '/about', '/cases', '/appointment', '/contact' each renders their respective page with visible content
No blank white screens appear in draft or live preview panes
The app mounts from main.tsx into #root in frontend/index.html

file_operations.description: Replace the placeholder App component with a React Router setup using BrowserRouter, Routes, and Route components to define client-side routes for '/' (Home), '/about', '/cases', '/appointment', and '/contact'. Wrap all routes in the shared Layout component. Import React Router from react-router-dom and all page components.
Create the Home page component that will be rendered at the '/' route. This file will contain the complete Home page structure (detailed in REQ-19).
Create the About page component that will be rendered at the '/about' route. This file will contain the complete About page structure (detailed in REQ-20).
Create the Cases page component that will be rendered at the '/cases' route. This file will contain the complete Cases/Services page structure (detailed in REQ-21).
Create the Appointment page component that will be rendered at the '/appointment' route. This file will contain the complete Appointment booking form structure (detailed in REQ-22).
Create the Contact page component that will be rendered at the '/contact' route. This file will contain the complete Contact page structure (detailed in REQ-23).

Create a custom React hook useScrollReveal that accepts a ref and returns a boolean indicating whether the element is in viewport. Use IntersectionObserver to detect when the ref element enters the viewport (threshold: 0.1). Return isVisible state. This hook will be used across multiple page components for scroll reveal animations.

Create a custom React hook useCountUp that accepts parameters (end: number, duration: number, isVisible: boolean) and returns the current count value. Use useEffect to animate the count from 0 to end over duration milliseconds when isVisible becomes true, using setInterval or requestAnimationFrame. This hook will be used for the stats counter animations on the Home page.

requirements.summary: Apply the premium visual theme consistently across all React page components using Tailwind CSS and a shared global stylesheet with gold accents, custom fonts, glassmorphism styling, scroll reveal animations, 3D tilt effects, and mobile-first responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Gold (#d4af37) accents appear on borders, underlines, badges, and hover states across all pages
Playfair Display is applied to all headings
Inter is applied to body text
Glassmorphism styling is visible on stat cards and quote blocks
3D tilt effect works on service cards when hovered
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile screens

file_operations.description: Extend the existing global stylesheet to include: (1) Google Fonts import for Playfair Display (weights 400, 700) and Inter (weights 400, 500, 600, 700) at the top; (2) Apply Playfair Display to all heading elements (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6) and Inter to body text; (3) Set html { scroll-behavior: smooth }; (4) Define CSS custom properties for gold color (--gold: #d4af37) and other theme colors; (5) Define reusable utility classes for glassmorphism styling (.glassmorphism with backdrop-filter: blur(10px), semi-transparent background, subtle border); (6) Define keyframes and animation classes for scroll reveal effects (.fade-in-up with opacity 0 to 1 and translateY); (7) Define utility classes for 3D tilt perspective effects (.tilt-container with perspective: 1000px); (8) Ensure all color references use Tailwind's extend config or CSS variables for gold accents.

Extend the existing Tailwind configuration to include: (1) Custom color 'gold' with value '#d4af37' in the theme.extend.colors object; (2) Custom font families: 'playfair' mapping to ['Playfair Display', 'serif'] and 'inter' mapping to ['Inter', 'sans-serif'] in theme.extend.fontFamily; (3) Ensure the extended config supports glassmorphism utilities (backdrop-filter plugin is already included); (4) Add any custom animation keyframes needed for pulse effects on WhatsApp button in theme.extend.animation if not already present.

Create a reusable SEO component that accepts props (title: string, description: string, keywords?: string, ogImage?: string, jsonLd?: object) and renders React Helmet with: (1) title tag, (2) meta description, (3) meta keywords if provided, (4) Open Graph tags (og:title, og:description, og:type, og:image if provided), (5) JSON-LD structured data script tag if jsonLd prop is provided. This component will be imported and used by all page components to ensure consistent SEO meta tags.
